description: In this series Daniel and Wes take a look at how to setup a wireless router in your home network. They talk about some of the considerations when it comes to implementing a wireless network like what standards, utilities, access point placement as well as interference and vendor documentation. They take you through the basic configurations to get your home router up and running.
name: Home Router Configuration
subtitle: Home Router Setup

episodes.description: In this segment, Wes and Daniel show you how to setup a home wireless router. They walk you through wireless options like setting the Service Set Identifier (SSID) name, configuring the encryption type, and changing the default channels that the wireless access point operates on.
episodes.title: Setting Up a Home Router

episodes.description: In this segment, Daniel and Wes take a look at configuring port forwarding on a basic home router. Wes uses the example of configuring port forwarding to allow a video game access to gaming server through the home routerâ€™s firewall. He also demonstrates setting up port forwarding to allow a user to access a home computer via RDP from outside the local network.
episodes.title: Port Forwarding
